episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a range of quirky and historical topics, including the early days of computer dating, the challenges of earning a Boy Scout invention badge, the use of cow horn in ancient windows, and Jack Kerouac's unique method of writing his novel on a scroll.

facts.fact: If you are 20 years old now, there is a chance that your great grandparents might have met thanks to computer dating.
One of the original 57 Boy Scout badges was the invention badge, which required kids to not only invent something new, but obtain a patent for it too.
One of London's oldest windows is made of cow horn.
Jack Kerouac wrote his most famous novel on one long scroll.
